creator: aquilo1@gmail.com
text:
I have been running Ontrack Fix-it utilities 3 for years and just upgraded to
V-COM Fix-It Utilities Professional 6, now Apache2 seems to be dependent on one
of it’s dll files MxAVlsp.dll, I’m not really sure if it Apache or PHP needing
the file and the only way I can reproduce the error (over and over again) is to
call any php page with phpinfo(); in it.

Here is the error I get:
szAppName : Apache.exe     szAppVer : 2.0.55.0     szModName : MxAVlsp.dll     
szModVer : 6.0.2.1     offset : 000019a9

I have stopped Fix-It Utilities processes and removed MxAVlsp.dll from it’s
installation and Apache2 will not restart after.

I have ininstalled V-COM Fix-It Utilities Professional 6 and Apache2 works
properly, so this is just a compatibility issue.


phpinfo:

apache2handler

Apache Version		Apache/2.0.55 (Win32) PHP/5.1.1
Apache API Version 	20020903
Server Administrator 	aquilo1@gmail.com
Hostname:Port		hidden/localhost:80
Max Requests		Per Child: 0 - Keep Alive: on - Max Per Connection: 100
Timeouts		Connection: 300 - Keep-Alive: 15
Virtual Server		No
Server Root		C:/Program Files/Apache Group/Apache
Loaded Modules 	core mod_win32 mpm_winnt http_core mod_so mod_php5 mod_access
mod_actions mod_alias mod_asis mod_auth mod_autoindex mod_cgi mod_dir mod_env
mod_imap mod_include mod_isapi mod_log_config mod_mime mod_negotiation
mod_setenvif mod_userdir


I notice it's sharing files with other programs aswell
PATH 	C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\system32\WBEM;C:\Program
Files\Common Files\Adaptec Shared\System;C:\Program
Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\;C:\Program Files\Microsoft USB Flash Drive Manager\

creator: aquilo1@gmail.com
text:
I have just reinstalled fix-it and everything is working, so Apache2 must have
included it when I upgraded from Apache 1.x
So presumably it's no longer supposed to be a bug report.
creator: nick@webthing.com
